item.description:
The Friends of Ellisville Marsh, Inc. will host its Fourth Annual Welcome Spring! Bird Walk on Saturday, May 18th, from 8:00 – 10:00 am (light rain or shine). Ellisville Marsh has been designated by Mass Audubon as a Massachusetts Important Bird Area and its adjacent beaches include protected nesting areas for threatened bird species.

Brad Winn will be our expert guide for this outing. Brad joined the Manomet Center for Conservation Sciences’ Shorebird Recovery Project as a conservation specialist in February 2011. Previously, Brad worked as a program manager for the Georgia Department of Natural Resources for more than a decade. He has participated in eight research expeditions to Arctic shorebird breeding areas in Alaska and eastern Canada. Brad is a member of the board of directors of the Friends of Ellisville Marsh.

The Welcome Spring! Bird Walk will meet up in the parking lot of Ellisville Harbor State Park. We will investigate the perimeter of the marsh, tidal flats, barrier beach and inlet, spying on migrating and breeding birds in each habitat. Bring binoculars or spotting scope and dress accordingly for the weather.

This event is open to Friends members and guests and will be held unless heavy rain or lightning is forecast.  Attendance is limited to fifty persons. To attend, please register in advance by sending an email to:  birdwalk@ellisvillemarsh.org.

Coffee and donuts will be provided.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Annual Ellisville Welcome Spring! Bird Walk
